author: awbr
content:
Hoping someone can help me confirm that it is accurate to say the following: 

“A max. of 16 VEMs are processed per block (every 12s), but there are no rules around the selection the the 16 VEMs that will be processed. Since VEMs will not necessarily be processed in the order they are submitted, the exact VEM processing time is indeterminate.”

Thank you!

author: barnabasbusa
content: Exits are processed by a similar queue system as deposits

author: barnabasbusa
content: It’s a FIFO queue system. So it’s fully predictable.

author: awbr
content: Thank you - this was my understanding for every step in the process, aside from the processing of signed VEMs (the step that changes an “active” validator to an “exiting” validator). I haven’t been able to find information about the order these VEMs are processed, but FIFO makes sense to me.
